definition: (coll.) to make fun of (sb)/to play tricks on

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to rinse/to trick/to fool sb/to cook by dipping finely sliced ingredients briefly in boiling water or soup (generally done at the dining table)

sentences.english: His colleagues baited him about his funny haircut.
sentences.chinese: 他的同事们拿他的搞笑发型开涮。

sentences.english: I wasn’t kidding about the French cooks.
sentences.chinese: 我可没有在拿法国厨子开涮。

sentences.english: His speech is full of jokes at my expense.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲里有好多笑话都是拿我开涮。

sentences.english: Looks like Paramount has sent a bath to theaters this week.
sentences.chinese: 看上去派拉蒙这星期是在拿剧院开涮。

definition: to make fun of/to seek diversion
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
to speak sarcastically/to make cutting remarks
to leak (of air)/to go flat (of a tire)/to vent one's anger
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
lit. mention the pot that doesn't boil (idiom); to touch a sore spot/to talk about sb's weak point
pinyin: na3 hu2 bu4 kai1 ti2 na3 hu2
